# Class Timetable Display Program # Periods (time slots) periods = [ "09:30 - 10:20", "10:20 - 11:10", "11:10 - 12:00", "12:00 - 12:50", "12:50 - 01:20 (Lunch)", "01:20 - 02:10", "02:10 - 03:00", "03:00 - 03:50", "03:50 - 04:40" ] # Timetable data (from the image you sent) timetable = { "Monday": [ "Fundamentals of Web Development (T)", "Engineering Physics (T)", "FREE", "FREE", "LUNCH", "Mathematics for Computer Science (T)", "Problem Solving with Python (T)", "FREE", "FREE" ], "Tuesday": [ "Problem Solving with Python (T)", "Problem Solving with Python (SL)", "Mathematics for Computer Science (T)", "FREE", "LUNCH", "Fundamentals of Web Development (T)", "Fundamentals of Web Development (SL)", "Engineering Physics (T)", "FREE" ], "Wednesday": [ "Mathematics for Computer Science (T)", "Engineering Physics (T)", "Fundamentals of Web Development (LAB)", "FREE", "LUNCH", "FREE", "Mathematics for Computer Science (SL)", "Talent Enrichment", "FREE" ], "Thursday": [ "Fundamentals of Web Development (LAB)", "Problem Solving with Python (LAB)", "FREE", "FREE", "LUNCH", "FREE", "Engineering Physics (SL)", "French/German", "FREE" ], "Friday": [ "Engineering Physics (LAB)", "Mathematics for Computer Science (P)", "FREE", "FREE", "LUNCH", "FREE", "Problem Solving with Python (LAB)", "French/German", "FREE" ] } # Print timetable print("\nðŸ“š CLASS TIMETABLE ðŸ“š\n") print("{:<10}".format("Day"), end="") for period in periods: print("{:<30}".format(period), end="") print("\n" + "-"*150) for day, subjects in timetable.items(): print("{:<10}".format(day), end="") for subject in subjects: print("{:<30}".format(subject), end="") print()
